name: OH! RPG!
description: Heroes always win! But what happens to those who don't? Play as unique and colorful characters as the world comes to an end after our heroes' utter defeat.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/Windows 7/8/8.1/10 (32bit/64bit) Processor: 1.6 GHz Memory: 128 MB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9.0 Compatible DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 800 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0 Compatible Sound

reviews.review_text: Disclaimer:  A key of the game was given to me by the developer himself, but this doesn't mean that it will reviewed in favor of the developer/publisher.    Insight upon playing the game in a single sitting (will add more contents once I complete the whole game):    Gameplay:  The gameplay of it stays true to the nature of JRPGs. The story starts in a creepy manner, wherein heroes fall to the 'Emperor' and gets obliterated (one of them got literally obliterated). Then as the story progresses, it is followed by well-executed humor.   Graphics:  Downright RPGMaker finish on the graphics. Nothing awfully bad, but nothing awfully good either.   Audio:  The BGMs and the SFX fit in each of the events. Pretty much an average finish.   [NOTE!]  As of the time this review was posted, I had a game breaking bug wherein when I launched the game, the menu screen lags terribly with no inputs being accepted by the game, yet the BGM and the confirmation beeps when the game starts are still there. A PC restart did nothing to solve it, but a full reinstall is the only solution that worked for me. I'm also not sure if this scenario is only on my part, since the computer that this was installed is only of entry-level specification.    Verdict:  7/10 as of now. Would be much higher if this bug will be resolved in the future. Though if I would say, that price point of 3$ is definitely worth it.

What can I say about this game that isn’t in the description? Unique twist indeed! The legendary heroes have failed to stop the evil emperor, and now the whole world feels the aftermath of the end of the world. You play in this RPG maker JRPG style game as minor characters, bit players, even monsters, and chickens, playing out your tiny bit of drama in this setting.  I’ve played quite a few RPG maker titles, and OH! RPG! is a shining gem, worth double the price they are asking for it and one that shouldn’t be passed over. The artwork is spot on, scripting is ingenious, and game play that is executed very well. All in all, you know what you’re getting into when you step into the shoes of OH! RPG! Yet, it’s an enjoyable experience for certain.   The ability to replay chapters adds another layer of depth and replayability, and for the price, I would not pass this one over if you’re looking for a JRPG. Note that I received a free copy of this game in exchange for my honest review. However that being said, the day I recieved the free copy, I had almost bought it anyways, and for the price, wouldn't have regretted that purchase at all.   NOTE - I was given a free copy of this game in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

A breath of fresh air from the recent onslaught of poorly made RPGMaker games from Steam. The combat system is very well designed although I find that the gameplay does get repetitive at times. It is also one of the most beautiful RPGMaker games I have ever seen. You can clearly see that the developer was intending to take full advantage of the MVEngine, becuase there's effects everywhere. Expect lag because of this, though. OH RPG offers a story told in different perspectives and ways which comes together well. If this is on sale, buy it! Its worth it if you like RPG and unqiue, innovative games.

I really loved a lot about this game, The characters, art, scenarios, and unique story made it stand out from a lot of other rpg maker rpgs. The only thing that bugged me was the 'stage select' nature of the game which made it hard to feel like i was accomplishing something, especially since factors like levels and items don't carry over and that 'stages' can be redone. Disclaimer: I was provided with an extra pre-release key from a friend. I am posting a review based on my own opinion.  OH! RPG! is a good short RPG game like the classic ones from 90s console games. It's enjoyable short game. The battles are tricky as you have limited recovery items and limited abilities to use. Depending on how well you perform affects the score you receive after the end of the chapter to unlock additional abilities.  It does have some challenging puzzles as you reach midway into the game that took a while to figure out how to solve them. The game doesn't have random battles grind. Overall it's enjoyable.

There you are. The final boss in the adventure, and the destiny of the realm rests in your ability to vanquish him. But unfortunately you fail and the world is going to get destroyed. Now you have to escape him and make it in time to watch the end of the world with your loved ones.  That´s the starting point of this adventure. You have to help the jer.. heores get back to their homes and loved ones using the help of NPCs, quite different ones depending on the stage you are in. Some of them include a goblin, an old lady or a nun, to name a few.  These stages have a strong strategy component. Your characters start with a predetermined level and have to beat  mostly all enemies during the stage, along with the smart use of the Hero calls during fights, to be able to get a chance to finish the stage boss and get a good rank (if you aren´t playing on easy mode, that is).  Which brings us to the User Ranks. This feature activates at the end of the stage and gives you a certain amount of points depending on difficulty, exp and gold earned. These ranks unlock certain helps and extras that makes the game easier and replayable, like the 'don Miguel' and Mapping Tools, that makes you revisit stages to find secrets that you couldn´t unlock the first time you played those stages.  All in all, a great, funny game that may be not that long (it´s, in words of the developers, 4 hours long), but with a great replay value. By the time i´m writing this review, i´ve clocked 18 hours and i´ve yet to unlock all the little secrets this game has to offer. Very recommended.
